properties.headline: Flood Watch issued February 10 at 4:10PM EST until February 11 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Jackson KY
properties.description:
...Additional Moderate to Heavy Rain Expected Across Southeast
Kentucky Tonight Into Tuesday Morning...

.A surface cold front will slide slowly southeast across eastern
Kentucky through Tuesday, producing a few rounds of moderate to
heavy rainfall across the area. With a saturated ground, any
additional rain will convert to mainly runoff and set the stage
for the possibility of renewed flooding - especially over the
Cumberland River basin.

The Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky,
including the following areas, in south central Kentucky,
McCreary and Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Bell, Harlan, and
Knox.

* Through Tuesday morning

* Moderate to heavy rainfall remains a concern today through
Tuesday morning, as a slow moving cold front pushes into the
area. This additional rainfall, on top of saturated soils,
will lead to a potential of renewed flooding.

* Minor flooding of low lying areas, as well as rivers, creeks,
and streams will be possible.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING
